meanings.definition: The quality of being exotic or foreign.
meanings.sent1: The exotisms of the foreign market fascinated the tourists.
meanings.sent2: She decorated her room with exotisms from different countries.
meanings.sent3: The exotisms of the new restaurant made everyone curious to try the food.
meanings.sent4: His stories were filled with exotisms that transported listeners to far-off lands.
meanings.sent5: The artist's paintings captured the exotisms of distant landscapes.

meanings.definition: The use of exotic elements or characteristics.
meanings.sent1: The chef's exotisms in the dish added unique flavors.
meanings.sent2: The fashion designer incorporated exotisms into her latest collection.
meanings.sent3: The exotisms in the music video created a visually stunning experience.
meanings.sent4: Her writing style was known for its exotisms that set it apart from others.
meanings.sent5: The garden was a beautiful display of colorful exotisms.

meanings.definition: The belief in the superiority of exotic cultures or customs.
meanings.sent1: His exotisms led him to believe that foreign traditions were always better.
meanings.sent2: The exotisms of some people can prevent them from appreciating their own culture.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly teased her friend about his exotisms towards foreign cuisine.
meanings.sent4: The exotisms of the explorer made him eager to learn about new cultures.
meanings.sent5: The professor's exotisms influenced his teaching methods to include diverse perspectives.
